result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamarion Douglas Finley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jamarion Douglas Finley not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Jamarion Douglas Finley.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting an additional status conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamarion Douglas Finley in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Jamarion Douglas Finley in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jamarion Douglas Finley in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Jamarion Douglas Finley in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamarion Douglas Finley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
